article.headline: Louisiana-Monroe 67, Ark.-Little Rock 64
article.story: LITTLE ROCK, Ark. -- Rudy Turner had 20 points and eight rebounds to lead Louisiana-Monroe to a 67-64 victory against Arkansas-Little Rock on Thursday night. With the Warhawks (11-14, 6-8 Sun Belt) leading 65-64 with 11 seconds remaining, Kenneth Averette made a pair of pressure free throws. Arkansas-Little Rock (7-17, 3-10) got a good look at a 3-point shot in the final seconds, but Matt Mouzy's attempt was off the mark. Dynile Forbes added 16 points and Lawrence Gilbert 10 for Louisiana-Monroe. Alex Garcia-Mendoza and Solomon Bozeman had 15 points and six rebounds apiece for the Trojans. Mouzy scored 13 points. The game featured eight ties and 16 lead changes.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).
